heisig_story: On the left we see a mound of dirt, and to the right flowers made to fit together. The two sides combine to create a great pagoda made of dirt, with flowers by the tens of thousands fitted together for the roofing of each of the layers. Be sure to put yourself in the scene and fit a few of the flowers in place yourself so that the image works its way into memory with full force.
koohiiStory1: In order to build a pagoda in this small Japanese garden everything has to fit: the soil to the left and the flowers in the upper right corner.

humanum_full_description_en:
From " earth " to " Xiao " sound, it was originally the Chinese transliteration of the Sanskrit "Pagoda". "Shuowen Xinfu": "The Buddha of the Western Regions. From the soil, the sound." The stupa originated in India, and it was "stūpa" in Sanskrit. It was made as a " tower " in the Jin-Song translation of the scriptures. Ge Hong's "The Garden of Characters" and the Southern Dynasty Liang Gu Ye Wang's "Yu Pian" and other books. Used to store relics. Later it was also used for the collection of scriptures, Buddha statues, Dharma implements, and solemn Buddhist temples. Southern Song Xie Lingyun's "Mountain Jufu": "Xie Lita is in the suburbs, and the world is near the city."

" Tower " can mean a Buddhist hall. "Wei Shu‧ Shi Lao Zhi": "Building a palace is called a tower."

" Tower " can also mean something in the shape of a tower. Song Fan Chengda's Travel Notes on Mount Emei: "Boloping has a tower of pine, which is like a cedar with round and thin leaves. It cannot be tall, and it is like a floating picture."
humanum_short_description_en: From the sound of " tu " and "荅", it was originally the Chinese transliteration of the Sanskrit "buddha".
humanum_full_description:
從「土」，「荅」聲，初為梵語「佛塔」的中文譯音。《說文新附》：「西域浮屠也。从土，荅聲。」 佛塔起源於印度，梵語為「窣堵坡」（stūpa），晉宋譯經時造為「塔」字，見於晉葛洪《字苑》、南朝梁顧野王《玉篇》等書。用以收藏舍利。後亦用於收藏經卷、佛像、法器，莊嚴佛寺等。南朝宋謝靈運〈山居賦〉：「謝麗塔於郊郭，殊世間於城傍。」

　　「塔」可表示佛堂。《魏書‧釋老志》：「建宮宇，謂為塔。」

　　「塔」還可表示塔形的東西。宋范成大〈峨眉山行記〉：「婆羅平有塔松，狀如杉而葉圓細，亦不能高，重重偃蹇如浮圖。」
humanum_short_description: 從「土」，「荅」聲，初為梵語「佛塔」的中文譯音。
